1.verse: The song of songs, which is Solomon's.

2.verse: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth:

3.verse: Because of the savour of thy good ointments

4.verse: Draw me, we will run after thee:

6.verse: Look not upon me, because I am black,

7.verse: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth,

9.verse: I have compared thee, O my love,

10.verse: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels ,

11.verse: We will make thee borders of gold

12.verse: While the King sitteth at his table,

13.verse: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me;

14.verse: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire

15.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my love;

16.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved,

17.verse: The beams of our house are cedar,

1.verse: I am the rose of Sharon,

3.verse: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood,

4.verse: He brought me to the banqueting house,

6.verse: His left hand is under my head,

7.verse: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: My beloved is like a roe

10.verse: My beloved spake, and said unto me,

11.verse: For, lo, the winter is past,

12.verse: The flowers appear on the earth;

13.verse: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs,

14.verse: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock,

16.verse: My beloved is mine, and I am his:

1.verse: By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth:

2.verse: I will rise now, and go about the city

3.verse: The watchmen that go about the city found me:

4.verse: It was but a little that I passed from them,

5.verse: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem,

6.verse: Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness

7.verse: Behold his bed, which is Solomon's;

9.verse: King Solomon made himself a chariot

10.verse: He made the pillars thereof of silver,

11.verse: Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion,

1.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my love;

2.verse: Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn,

3.verse: Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet,

4.verse: Thy neck is like the tower of David

5.verse: Thy two breasts are like two young roes

7.verse: Thou art all fair, my love;

8.verse: Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse,

9.verse: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse;

10.verse: How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse!

11.verse: Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb:

12.verse: A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse;

13.verse: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates,

1.verse: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse:

2.verse: I sleep, but my heart waketh:

3.verse: I have put off my coat;

4.verse: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door ,

5.verse: I rose up to open to my beloved;

7.verse: The watchmen that went about the city found me,

8.verse: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: What is thy beloved more than another beloved,

10.verse: My beloved is white and ruddy,

11.verse: His head is as the most fine gold,

12.verse: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters,

13.verse: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers:

14.verse: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl:

15.verse: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold:

2.verse: My beloved is gone down into his garden,

3.verse: I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine:

4.verse: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah,

5.verse: Turn away thine eyes from me,

6.verse: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep

7.verse: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples

8.verse: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines,

9.verse: My dove, my undefiled is but one;

10.verse: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning,

11.verse: I went down into the garden of nuts

1.verse: How beautiful are thy feet with shoes,

2.verse: Thy navel is like a round goblet,

3.verse: Thy two breasts are like two young roes

4.verse: Thy neck is as a tower of ivory;

5.verse: Thine head upon thee is like Carmel,

6.verse: How fair and how pleasant art thou,

7.verse: This thy stature is like to a palm tree,

8.verse: I said, I will go up to the palm tree,

9.verse: And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine

12.verse: Let us get up early to the vineyards;

1.verse: O that thou wert as my brother,

3.verse: His left hand should be under my head,

4.verse: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

5.verse: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness,

6.verse: Set me as a seal upon thine heart,

11.verse: Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon;

12.verse: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me:

13.verse: Thou that dwellest in the gardens,
